He built a bank called Letter which didn't work out...and now he's Head of Design at Clerk and back to chasing that next big thing. :link: https://changelog.fm/639

In the Hard Beliefs section the guest mentions that product managers without design, sales, or engineering experience are useless. I totally agree

They then go on to rhetorically ask why CEOs let this happen (hire product managers like this). Simple answer! Most CEOs themselves are that way! They don't have the experience and they suck too!
Maybe "founder mode" should be executives becoming more discerning when they hire managers and product managers :)

Man, this reminds me how much fun it was to be in fintech in 2023Q1.

[Narrator: it was not]
product managers are there to take the blame when things go bad. That's the only skill they need really. The ability to be blamed and then fired.
Huh, the idea that cryptocurrency could bait speculative investors away from real estate ... mind blown
